Here's a way to look at your specific method.=C2=A0 You say that David gave=
 you the answer.=C2=A0 But, you were not able to hear it, or would not acce=
pt it, until I told you what it was.=C2=A0 That would sound like a frustrat=
ing situation for David, and you.=C2=A0 But, this experiment could in theor=
y help there, by making it more clear to you when you have heard a valid me=
ssage, versus when you have imposed your own prejudices into the sound (as =
in this case, you said you did not believe a radio could fit on the monitor=
).=C2=A0=C2=A0 So in your methodology this would be of benefit both to you =
(because you could improve your skills through these experiments) and to Da=
vid (as he would not have to have you miss what he was saying as often).

-=
-- On Wed, 7/14/10, SnowfireL@... <SnowfireL@...> wrote:

=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      


Well, the problem =
RJ, is all the voices that are coming 
through all the time, some of them a=
re from lower levels or plains, they are 
usually easier to hear, because t=
hey are closer, unless of course they happen to 
be=C2=A0tech's or our guid=
es and angels.=C2=A0 The spirit's with the most 
credibility=C2=A0are going=
 to be=C2=A0harder to hear, since they are well beyond 
the white light, an=
d are in much higher plains.=C2=A0 They read our minds, as 
they can read t=
he minds of each other, only the ones in lower plains are not 
able to read=
 the minds of those higher spirits if they choose to not reveal 
themselves=
.=C2=A0 Because of this it's going to be tough, if I gave everyone's 
opini=
on out of the 4 minutes, you could write a book, then when I found Dave's 
=
voice, he was not so easy to hear, I had to make it louder, when I tried to=
 
reach Him on Skype, I couldn't get what He said correctly, so it was my o=
wn 
fault, and=C2=A0not His. sf
=C2=A0

In a message dated 7/14/2010 6:27:0=
9 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, 
rasterer@yahoo. com writes:
=C2=A0 
  
  
  =

    
    
      I think it does matter though. 

One of the things 
      =
  we're trying to do is set up an objective framework for experimenting 
  =
      with some of these aspects.=C2=A0 I think we have all experienced the=
 
        difficulty in hearing what is on some of these recordings: someti=
mes 
        we're not sure at first what it says. Sometimes we ask others =
for their 
        input.=C2=A0 Sometimes we only hear it once someone else=
 tells us it 
        first.=C2=A0 Sometimes we hear it wrong.=C2=A0 Someti=
mes we hear it 
        right. And so on.

It would be useful to know, as a=
n individual, 
        how good we are at hearing it right, so we have some=
 idea how 
        trustworthy our skill, or methods, or technology, is.=C2=
=A0 If we can 
        measure that, or even get a feel for it, we can look=
 for ways to improve 
        it.=C2=A0 If we can't measure it, then we cou=
ld be stuck.=C2=A0 
        

So, by restricting the answers only to the ti=
meframe of the 
        experiment, we can help filter out some of the prob=
lems of subjectivity: 
        for example, one theory is that people can h=
ear what they want to hear, 
        or can these sounds in a certain way, =
once you already know the 
        answer.=C2=A0 Or, given 2 ways to hear a=
 sound, being influenced, even 
        subconsciously, to hear it one way =
over the other.=C2=A0 We want to rule 
        that out.

This is one reaso=
n we can only count on answers given 
        during the timeframe.=C2=A0 T=
hat is when the answer is most 
        objective.=C2=A0 Once the object ha=
s been announced, we move into 
        a=C2=A0 period where we can't disco=
unt possible influence from already 
        knowing the answer.

But, I am=
 confident that if a person's method 
        or technology really can reve=
al the correct answer outside the 
        timeframe, then doing it within =
the timeframe should be just as easy, 
        and would then be a valid ob=
jective result for all to see.

                Snowfire, as I noted at th=
e beginning of the 
                  test, sending in results after I alre=
ady announced what the 
                  object is can't of course be part=
 of the experiment.=C2=A0 
                  Someone could simply read what=
 I said, and it could then 
                  influence their own interpret=
ation of ramdom noise, for 
                  example, or they could say "I=
 got it but forgot to mail it", 
                  or a host of other reaso=
ns.

To make the experiment as 
                  objective as possible, on=
ly answers sent during the 
                  experiment's timeframe can be=
 valid.

                     =C2=A0 
                                
             =
                   
Thanks again for everyone who 
                        =
        participated! I admire your courage and 
                          =
      motivation to try different methods, see what 
                      =
          works, and try to improve everyone's 
                           =
     understanding of EVP-ITC.

If you recall, 
                           =
     on 7/10/2010 I placed an object on top of my 
                        =
        computer monitor, right in front of me, and left 
                 =
               it there until today, 7/14/2010, noon Denver 
              =
                  time. The experiment was for participants to 
           =
                     determine what it was. Vague or partial answers 
     =
                           wouldn't be counted (for example, just colors, 
=
                                shapes, sizes, what it's made of, etc): we'=
re 
                                looking for what it is. Participants co=
uld use 
                                their ghost boxes, EVP recorders, =
or I suppose 
                                any other means they chose.

=
In order to 
                                keep me honest, I took a pictu=
re of the object 
                                at the start of the exper=
iment and loaded it to 
                                the Files section (=
RJ folder) of this group. If 
                                you can follo=
w the link, it is here:

http://tech. 
                                grou=
ps.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ 
                                RJ/RJ.=
20100710. 1.zip

The idea was 
                                that you cou=
ld download the file at the 
                                beginning of t=
he test, and 'keep it safe' on 
                                your comput=
er. Then at the end of the test, I 
                                would r=
elease the password so you could reveal 
                                th=
e contents of the file. That way, you were in 
                            =
    control of the original image during the entire 
                      =
          test, not me. 

The password for that file 
                     =
           is: 123BlastOff
Instructions, if you need 
                     =
           them, are also in that RJ folder.

And if 
                     =
           you did not care to download the zip file before 
              =
                  the test, I will post the final image there 
            =
                    too.

So to the results:

Number of 
                  =
              participants: 5
Total tries: 8
Ambiguous 
                   =
             answers: 0
Correct answers: 0

Object: 
                      =
          A radio
Uzipped picture:
http://tech. 
                          =
      groups.yahoo. com/group/ EVP-ITC/files/ 
                            =
    RJ/RJ.20100710. 1.JPG

So what do the 
                                =
results mean? All that we can really agree on 
                            =
    from this experiment is that no participant, 
                         =
       with whatever theories or methods or technology 
                   =
             they used, was able to correctly determine the 
              =
                  object. We can't say those theories or methods 
         =
                       or technologies never work. Just as we can't say 
  =
                              they do. Just that, for whatever reason, they=
 
                                did not work this time. Readers can take =
the 
                                results, use them to improve or change=
 their 
                                methods, or keep doing what they're=
 
                                doing.

If anyone has any observations, 
=
                                comments, or ideas for improvement, let me =
know. 
                                I hope to get a new experiment up an=
d running 
                                soon. Since there wasn't much pa=
rticipation 
                                Mon-Wed, I think the next expe=
riment will be 
                                arranged to mostly span the=
 
                                weekends.

Again, thanks to everyone who =

                                participated in this first 
              =
                  experiment.


                                
          =
                    
                              
                       =
       

                      

            

  


    
     

    
    

=

  <p><br>Thanks again for everyone who

ticipated! I admire your courage and

orks, and try to improve everyone's

tanding of EVP-ITC.<br><br>If you recall, 
                                =
on 7/10/2010 I placed an object on top of my 
                             =

                      =
          it there until today, 7/14/2010, noon Denver 
                   =

     =
                           shapes, sizes, what it's made of, etc): we're

se

suppose

oups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/RJ/RJ.20100710.1.zip" target=3D"_blank" =
